conclusion: A and B are moving towards each other in the same direction, and the task is to determine their final positions based on power, collision, and deflection effects.
Vehicle A is positioned on the left side of the image and is moving toward the right.
Vehicle B is positioned on the right side of the image and is moving toward the left.
The two vehicles collide roughly in the middle of the scene.
Vehicle B is heavier/faster and transfers more momentum to Vehicle A during the collision.
After impact, Vehicle B is slightly deflected and rolls a short distance to the left of the impact point before stopping.
Vehicle A receives most of the impulse, is pushed backward, and comes to rest a short distance to the right of its original lane.
Vehicle A stops a little to the right of the central purple cube.
Vehicle B stops just to the left of the yellow cube.
